item.title: By: lucilia marinho
item.dc:creator: lucilia marinho
item.description: i`m portuguese and i have the pleasure to give you the recipe of PASTÃ‰IS DE BELÃ‰M. 12egg yolks ,300g sugar 50gflour,6oogwhater,salt-half cofeespoon,puff pastry-qbput the whater,sugar,and the flour in a sauce pan and whisk together.Place the pan over medium heat and cook.Remove.Join teh egg yolks whisked with the salt lightly.Place the pan again over medium heat and cook until the mixture thickens.Transfer to a bowl,cover with plastic wrap and leave to cool.The method to cover the holes is the same of your recipe.Iwhishyou like.This is a genuine portuguese recipe .Excuse me my bad english
item.content:encoded: i`m portuguese and i have the pleasure to give you the recipe of PASTÃ‰IS DE BELÃ‰M. 12egg yolks ,300g sugar 50gflour,6oogwhater,salt-half cofeespoon,puff pastry-qbput the whater,sugar,and the flour in a sauce pan and whisk together.Place the pan over medium heat and cook.Remove.Join teh egg yolks whisked with the salt lightly.Place the pan again over medium heat and cook until the mixture thickens.Transfer to a bowl,cover with plastic wrap and leave to cool.The method to cover the holes is the same of your recipe.Iwhishyou like.This is a genuine portuguese recipe .Excuse me my bad english

item.title: By: Rachel
item.dc:creator: Rachel
item.description: I made these for a neighbourhood Christmas party on the weekend and they were just divine! I made them as instructed and they really were every bit as delicious as the ones sold in my local patisserie for $3 each! I made an orange caramel (juice of one orange, 4Tbs brown sugar, reduce over a high heat for 10 mins) and spooned over the top and left to set - gave the tarts a real lift and complimented the flavour of the custard tremendously well. The only thing I would advise is to not over-fill the cases with too much custard, which rises during the oven cooking and did overflow in a couple of tarts. Won't ever buy these again now that I know how easy they are to make.
item.content:encoded:
I made these for a neighbourhood Christmas party on the weekend and they were just divine!
I made them as instructed and they really were every bit as delicious as the ones sold in my local patisserie for $3 each!
I made an orange caramel (juice of one orange, 4Tbs brown sugar, reduce over a high heat for 10 mins) and spooned over the top and left to set – gave the tarts a real lift and complimented the flavour of the custard tremendously well.
The only thing I would advise is to not over-fill the cases with too much custard, which rises during the oven cooking and did overflow in a couple of tarts.
Won’t ever buy these again now that I know how easy they are to make.

item.title: By: Krystal
item.dc:creator: Krystal
item.description: Hi there, i made these tonight from your recipie, added a teaspoon of coconut oil and they were delicious! Not too rich or eggy, i did use probably too much pastry but they worked really well! Thank you so much! :)
item.content:encoded:
Hi there, i made these tonight from your recipie, added a teaspoon of coconut oil and they were delicious! Not too rich or eggy, i did use probably too much pastry but they worked really well!
Thank you so much! ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Jeff & Raynie
item.dc:creator: Jeff & Raynie
item.description: Hi Anita, My daughter (14) & I enjoy cooking together (she cooks..I clean) she is adamant that we must follow a recipe to a T - which we did & these turned out absolutely perfect! Thanks. No problems with the custard or pastry (puff) - fun to make! I'm now in trouble 'cause I've knocked off 3 of them while she is outside on the scooter...OOOPs!
item.content:encoded:
Hi Anita,
My daughter (14) & I enjoy cooking together (she cooks..I clean) she is adamant that we must follow a recipe to a T – which we did & these turned out absolutely perfect! Thanks. No problems with the custard or pastry (puff) – fun to make! I’m now in trouble ’cause I’ve knocked off 3 of them while she is outside on the scooter…OOOPs!

item.description: Hi is the custard meant to boil in the cases while its baking in the oven. Also do they always "go down" in centre when out and cooling ? thanks

item.title: By: Susanna
item.dc:creator: Susanna
item.description: I made these as dessert for new year's eve with a cinnamon cream poured over them and they were fantastic. Everybody loved them. Will be emailing the recipe to a few people! Thanks
item.content:encoded: I made these as dessert for new year’s eve with a cinnamon cream poured over them and they were fantastic. Everybody loved them. Will be emailing the recipe to a few people! Thanks

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/portuguese-custard-tarts/comment-page-1/#comment-2702">Cathy</a>.
Hi Cathy The pastry used in this recipe is just puff pastry - it can be found in the freezer section, sold in 6 sheet packets. Hope you enjoy it! Cheers Anita
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Cathy.

Hi Cathy
The pastry used in this recipe is just puff pastry – it can be found in the freezer section, sold in 6 sheet packets.
Hope you enjoy it!
Cheers
Anita
